title.bibl: Revyen, July 8, 1905. [New Danish Children's Home to Be Built]

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

div.bibl: Revyen, July 8, 1905. [NEW DANISH CHILDREN'S HOME TO BE BUILT]

body.p: The new Danish Children's Home will be built on the corner of Evergreen and Spaulding Avenues, where the committee has bought three lots with a frontage of one hundred feet on Evergreen Avenue. The price paid was $3,000. Architect Charles F. Sorensen estimates that the cost of the new building will be $11,000. The members of the building committee are S. J. Black, S. N. Nielsen, and C. H. C. Nielsen.
